result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin W Wilkins

records.addlTxt: Defendant Justin W Wilkins in court.  Attorney Steven C. Harvey in court for Justin W Wilkins.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has proof of treatment and future appointments. Record as to family violence intervention program, defendant begins this weekend, 24 week program. Record by State as to records request and dispute within the COC office. Judge will not get involved, it is the responsibility between the DA office and CoC office. Future dates remain. Minutes filed.

Defendant in court with attorney Steven Harvey. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is not confirming for trial. Speedy demand from 8-22-22 is being withdrawn. Just received plea offer. State does not take a position on adjournment. Record by Atty Harvey as to defendant's current status and bond motion. Court makes record as to decision in recent bond modification. Matter to be set over next week on the 1:15 call. Court would like report of progress with Creedence and terms of the bond. Court inquires if victim is present; none present.
Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 22, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Justin W Wilkins in court.  Attorney Steven C. Harvey in court for Justin W Wilkins.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Harvey, State objects. Bond amended to no violent contact. Minutes filed.
Order for Representation Amended
Proposed Order for Representation Amended

Defendant Justin W Wilkins in court.  Attorney Steven C. Harvey in court for Justin W Wilkins.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Harvey motions the court to modify bond-DENIED, bond remains. Amended information filed. Information mirrors complaint in this case. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver form filed. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Speedy trial demanded by defendant. Trial dates set, Minutes filed.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

*AMENDED 9/7/2022: If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.

Defendant Justin W Wilkins in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Steven Harvey for defendant. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Harvey, granted. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Victim's Request to Lift the No Contact

Defendant Justin W Wilkins in court. Attorney Steven Harvey for defendant. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State. State charging on this file, 1-2 days needed for PH and bond motion to be filed. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

**AMENDED 10/03/2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH C.M.S. dob 10-05-1994, HER CHILD OR RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. BY TIME OF FINAL PRE-TRIAL ON 10-26-22, DEFENDANT MUST PROVIDE PROOF OF ENROLLMENT IN COUNSELING ELEMENTS OUTLINED BY CAROL O'FLANAGAN FROM THE WAY.**
*AMENDED 9/7/2022: If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. 

BOND TO COVER 22CF471, 22CM115, 22CT85, 22CF116, 21CF670, & 21CF154

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.M.S. dob 10-5-1994, HER CHILD OR HER RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
22-3886 thru 3889

Called at 1:33 PM. Defendant Justin W Wilkins in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Steven Harvey for defendant. Record by Attorney Harvey who represents defendant on other files. Discussion as to bond. State asks prior bond to be forfeited. Further discussion/ response by Attorney Harvey.  Total bond set at $10000 cash. Same prior conditions plus no weapons and new no contact. Prior bond is forfeited. Statement by defendant. Other files already set. Speedy demand on other files. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Arrest
